original: Dusen, Einar Axel, redaktör, Norrköping, f. 9/4/90 i Linköp. av Hjalmar D. o. Charlotta Maria Nilsson. G. 15 m. Elvira Ebba Lundeli. Barn: Holger f. 17, Gun-Britt 21, Vivan 24. — Utg. Norrköp.-Kamraternas Medl:-blad 20-27, red. o. äg. av tidn. Sport o. Boulevard sed. 28, medarb. i ett flert. tidn. o. tidskr. Sign.: Mr Kix, Pilo, Sinka-Dus, E-é-. Led. av styr. f. IFK Norrköp. 16-34, stift, av Norrköp. fotb :domarekl. o. dess sekr. 22-24, led. av östergötl. fotb :förb. läns-komm. uttagn :komm., init:tag. t. Äldre IFK:are. Första kl. dom. i fotb. 15-35, i bandy 20-34. Hobbies: filateli, friluftsliv. Distr :mäst. i fotb. 12-13 o. i bandy 17, inneh. ett flert. idrottsl. förtj :tecken.
translated: Dusen, Einar Axel, editor, Norrköping, b. April 9, 1890 in Linköping, son of Hjalmar D. and Charlotta Maria Nilsson. Married in 1915 to Elvira Ebba Lundeli. Children: Holger b. 1917, Gun-Britt b. 1921, Vivan b. 1924. Published Norrköp.-Kamraternas Medl:-blad from 1920-1927. Editor and owner of the newspaper Sport and Boulevard from 1928. Contributor to several other newspapers and magazines. Pseudonyms: Mr Kix, Pilo, Sinka-Dus, E-é-. Board member of IFK Norrköp. from 1916-1934. Chairman of the Norrköp. football referee board and its secretary from 1922-1924. Member of the Östergötl. football association county committee and selection committee. Founder of the Older IFK sports club. Certified referee in football from 1915-1935 and in bandy from 1920-1934. Hobbies include philately and outdoor activities. District champion in football in 1912-1913 and in bandy in 1917. Holder of several sports commendations.

structured.name: Einar Axel Dusen
structured.description: Einar Axel Dusen was a Swedish editor, born on April 9, 1890 in Linköping. He was the son of Hjalmar Dusen and Charlotta Maria Nilsson, and was married to Elvira Ebba Lundeli in 1915. He had three children, Holger, Gun-Britt, and Vivan. Dusen published Norrköp.-Kamraternas Medl:-blad from 1920-1927 and was the editor and owner of the newspaper Sport and Boulevard from 1928. He was also a contributor to several other newspapers and magazines, and had several pseudonyms such as Mr Kix, Pilo, Sinka-Dus, and E-é-. Dusen was a board member of IFK Norrköp. from 1916-1934, and was the chairman of the Norrköp. football referee board and its secretary from 1922-1924. He was a member of the Östergötl. football association county committee and selection committee, and was the founder of the Older IFK sports club. Dusen was a certified referee in football from 1915-1935 and in bandy from 1920-1934. His hobbies included philately and outdoor activities, and he was a district champion in football in 1912-1913 and in bandy in 1917. He held several sports commendations.
